## Pre-class Prep

Please be sure to complete the following before class:

### Install required packages

```{r}
#| eval: false
#| echo: true
#| code-line-numbers: false
install.packages("paletteer") # a comprehensive collection of color palettes in R using a common interface
install.packages("viridis") # Colorblind-Friendly Color Maps for R
install.packages("RColorBrewer") # ColorBrewer Palettes
install.packages("maps") # for drawing geographical maps
```

### Download data
 
- [County-level precipitation data (October 2023) for the contiguous U.S](https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/monitoring/climate-at-a-glance/county/mapping/110/pcp/202312/1/value), made available by [NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI)](https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/) (the download buttons are located just beneath the rendered map -- **choose the CSV option**)
  - rename the data file as `county-precip-dec2023.csv` and save it to your class repo at the file path: `EDS-240-class-examples/week5/data/county-precip-dec2023.csv`

### Install Google Chrome extensions (optional, but recommended)

I'll be using both of these (really wonderful and easy-to-use) tools during lecture and encourage you to install them!

1. [Let's get color blind](https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/lets-get-color-blind/bkdgdianpkfahpkmphgehigalpighjck): simulates different color deficiencies in the browser
2. [ColorPick Eyedropper](https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/colorpick-eyedropper/ohcpnigalekghcmgcdcenkpelffpdolg): a browser-based color chooser tool (I recommended that you install this for week 3 discussion, so you may already have it!)
